meanings.definition: Hit or strike (someone) with a blackjack.
meanings.sent1: He blackjacked the door to break it open.
meanings.sent2: The thief blackjacked the security guard during the heist.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat blackjacked the toy mouse across the room.
meanings.sent4: The storm blackjacked the trees, bending them with its fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith blackjacked the red-hot iron to shape it into a horseshoe.

meanings.definition: Defeat or outmaneuver (someone) by using force or coercion.
meanings.sent1: She blackjacked her opponent in the chess match with a clever move.
meanings.sent2: The bully blackjacked the smaller kids into giving him their lunch money.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox blackjacked the rabbit out of its hiding spot.
meanings.sent4: The cunning spy blackjacked the enemy's plans, gaining a strategic advantage.
meanings.sent5: The determined athlete blackjacked the odds to win the race against all expectations.
